title: getting-started
text: metricminer R package helps mine metrics common places web power APIs. also helps make data format easily used dashboard purposes. associated dashboard template tutorials help fully use data retrieve metricminer (still development!) can read metricminer package documentation .

text: Currently metricminer supports mining data : Calendly GitHub Google Analytics Google Forms Slido export files stored Googledrive

title: getting-started
text: metricminer attempts retrieve API data give format tidy data.frame. means metricminer opinionated metrics returns fits useful human ready read data frame. find data returned need two options (options can pursued concurrently): can set dataformat argument "raw" see original, unedited JSON formatted data returned API. can personally look data want extract . can post GitHub issue explain metric missing data frame formatted data included. possible reasonable, can work including data next version metricminer.

text: start, need authorize() package access data. run authorize() asked app ’d like authorize whether ’d like cache auth information. already know app ’d like authorize, like google example, can run authorize("google"). follow instructions upcoming screens select scopes feel comfortable sharing (generally just need read permissions metricminer able collect data). want clear authorizations caches stored metricminer can run:

title: getting-started
text: can retrieve metrics repository GitHub :

title: getting-started
text: can retrieve calendly events information using type workflow:
code: authorize("calendly") user <- get_calendly_user() events <- list_calendly_events(user = user$resource$uri)

title: getting-started
text: can retrieve Google Analytics data websites like . First retrieve account information ’ve authorized. need retrieve properties (aka usually websites tracking) underneath account. Just need shave properties/ bit string. Now can collect stats. Google Analytics metrics basic numbers (many visits website, etc.). Whereas dimensions list events happened. ’s list people logged . Lastly, third option collecting link_clicks links clicked. also known dimension according Google analytics, often isn’t compatible us download link click data time dimension data metricminer collect separately.
code: authorize("google") accounts <- get_ga_user() properties_list <- get_ga_properties(account_id = accounts$id[1]) property_id <- gsub("properties/", "", properties_list$properties$name[1]) metrics <- get_ga_stats(property_id, stats_type = "metrics") dimensions <- get_ga_stats(property_id, stats_type = "dimensions") link_clicks <- get_ga_stats(property_id, stats_type = "link_clicks")

title: getting-started
text: ’d like authorize non-interactively (whether GitHub actions locally) can set tokens using Sys.setenv()

title: getting-started
text: can go get API key. likely login first. can store putting API key type command: Now script run following, authorization Calendly.
code: Sys.setenv(METRICMINER_CALENDLY = "Put calendly token here") auth_from_secret("calendly", token = Sys.getenv("METRICMINER_CALENDLY"))

title: getting-started
text: Similar steps can done GitHub personal access token. First go get GitHub PAT. likely login first. can run command put GitHub PAT . Now script run following, authorization GitHub.
code: Sys.setenv(METRICMINER_GITHUB_PAT = "Put GitHub PAT here") # Authorize GitHub auth_from_secret("github", token = Sys.getenv("METRICMINER_GITHUB_PAT"))

title: getting-started
text: Google can authorize secret normal interactive way using authorize("google") storing result like : can use object extract two secrets printing like : token$credentials$access_token token$credentials$refresh_token can set environment steps : Now script run following authorization Google Apps.
code: token <- authorize("google") Sys.setenv(METRICMINER_GOOGLE_ACCESS = "Google access token here")  Sys.setenv(METRICMINER_GOOGLE_REFRESH = "Google refresh token here") # Authorize Google auth_from_secret("google",                  refresh_token = Sys.getenv("METRICMINER_GOOGLE_REFRESH"),                  access_token = Sys.getenv("METRICMINER_GOOGLE_ACCESS"),                  cache = TRUE )

title: getting-started
text: GitHub can run metricminer using authorization use steps retrieve necessary keys store GitHub Secrets. Read store GitHub secrets ’ll need secrets stored respective key name ’ve referenced : GitHub action yaml ’ll need something like extract authorize secrets environment.
code: METRICMINER_CALENDLY METRICMINER_GITHUB_PAT METRICMINER_GOOGLE_REFRESH METRICMINER_GOOGLE_ACCESS - name: Authorize metricminer         env:           METRICMINER_CALENDLY: ${{ secrets.METRICMINER_CALENDLY }}           METRICMINER_GITHUB_PAT: ${{ secrets.METRICMINER_GITHUB_PAT }}           METRICMINER_GOOGLE_ACCESS: ${{ secrets.METRICMINER_GOOGLE_ACCESS }}           METRICMINER_GOOGLE_REFRESH: ${{ secrets.METRICMINER_GOOGLE_REFRESH }}         run: |           # Authorize Calendly           auth_from_secret("calendly", token = Sys.getenv("METRICMINER_CALENDLY"))            # Authorize GitHub           auth_from_secret("github", token = Sys.getenv("METRICMINER_GITHUB_PAT"))            # Authorize Google           auth_from_secret("google",                  refresh_token = Sys.getenv("METRICMINER_GOOGLE_REFRESH"),                  access_token = Sys.getenv("METRICMINER_GOOGLE_ACCESS"),                  cache = TRUE           )            ### Now run the R commands you want here or call an R script in a later step.         shell: Rscript {0}

title: Get all metrics for all properties associated with an account — all_ga_metrics
text: account_id account id like retrieve stats properties associated . property_names vector property names stats retrieved . title: Get all metrics for all properties associated with an account — all_ga_metrics
text: Either list dataframes `metrics`, `dimensions` `link clicks` reported. `format` set "raw" original raw API results returned

title: Get all metrics for all properties associated with an account — all_ga_metrics
code: if (FALSE) {  authorize("google") accounts <- get_ga_user()  stats_list <- all_ga_metrics(account_id = accounts$id[5])  property_names <- c("358228687", "377543643", "377952717")  some_stats_list <- all_ga_metrics(property_names = property_names) }

title: Use secrets to Authorize R package to access endpoints — auth_from_secret
code: auth_from_secret(   app_name,   token,   access_token,   refresh_token,   cache = FALSE,   in_test = TRUE )

title: Use secrets to Authorize R package to access endpoints — auth_from_secret
text: app_name app trying authorize? 'google', 'calendly' 'github'? token calendly github, pass API key Personal Access Token set going https://github.com/settings/tokens/new https://calendly.com/integrations/api_webhooks respectively. access_token Google, access token can obtained running authorize interactively: token <-authorize(); token$credentials$access_token refresh_token Google, refresh token can obtained running authorize interactively: token <-authorize(); token$credentials$refresh_token cache credentials cached? TRUE FALSE? in_test setting auth test, set TRUE way authorization stick

title: Use secrets to Authorize R package to access endpoints — auth_from_secret
text: OAuth token saved environment package can use users' Google data

title: Use secrets to Authorize R package to access endpoints — auth_from_secret
code: if (FALSE) {  # Example for authorizing Calendly # You go to https://calendly.com/integrations/api_webhooks to get an api key auth_from_secret("calendly", token = "A_calendly_token_here")  # Example for GitHub # You go to https://github.com/settings/tokens/new to get a Personal Access Token auth_from_secret("github", token = "ghp_a_github_pat_here")  # Example for authorizing for Google token <- authorize("google") auth_from_secret(   app_name = "google",   refresh_token = token$credentials$access_token,   access_token = token$credentials$refresh_token ) }

Usually looks like "https://api.calendly.com/users/c208a750-9214-4c62-9ee6-a1a9507c7b43" count paginated GETs, can specify many things like returned page_token paginated GET, page ?

code: if (FALSE) {  authorize("calendly") token <- get_token(app_name = "calendly")  result_list <- calendly_get(   url = "https://api.calendly.com/users/me",   token = token ) }

title: Get stats for an associated Google Analytics property — get_ga_stats
code: get_ga_stats(   property_id,   start_date = "2015-08-14",   token = NULL,   body_params = NULL,   end_date = NULL,   stats_type = "metrics",   dataformat = "dataframe" )

title: Get stats for an associated Google Analytics property — get_ga_stats
text: property_id GA property. Looks like '123456789' Can obtained running `get_ga_properties()` start_date YYYY-MM-DD format metric like collect metrics start. Default earliest date Google Analytics collected. token credentials access Google using OAuth.  `authorize("google")` body_params body parameters request end_date YYYY-MM-DD format metric like collect metrics end. Default today. stats_type want retrieve metrics dimensions? dataformat like data returned ? Default "dataframe" like see original API list result, put "raw".

title: Get stats for an associated Google Analytics property — get_ga_stats
code: if (FALSE) {  authorize("google") accounts <- get_ga_user()  properties_list <- get_ga_properties(account_id = accounts$id[1])  property_id <- gsub("properties/", "", properties_list$properties$name[1]) metrics <- get_ga_stats(property_id, stats_type = "metrics") dimensions <- get_ga_stats(property_id, stats_type = "dimensions") }
